description: Follow live text commentary as New Zealand face Philippines in Group A of the 2023 Women's World Cup.
title: Fifa Women's World Cup LIVE: New Zealand vs Philippines score, commentary & updates from Group A game
title_page: Fifa Women's World Cup LIVE: New Zealand vs Philippines score, commentary & updates from Group A game - BBC Sport
maintext:
Follow Switzerland vs Norway
FT: New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
That's all from us. You can follow live text coverage of the other match in Group A where Switzerland can now go through to the last 16 with victory over Norway.
This result has also given Norway a pretty strong lifeline. All to play for. That game kicks off in half an hour.
Follow that match here.
FULL-TIME
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
ALL OVER. Incredible victory for the Philippines. The substitutes sprint onto the pitch at the sound of the whistle. Players from both sides have got their heads in their hands - the victorious in disbelief and the New Zealanders in disappointment. Huge result.
They are the first debutants to pick up a win at this tournament and it might prevent the co-hosts from progressing to the last 16. Wow.
'Save of the tournament'
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
Emma Byrne
Former Ireland goalkeeper on ITV1
What a save!
Absolutely incredible, that's an incredible save by McDaniel. She gets so far down to her left to push it away.
That's the save of the tournament so far.
GREAT SAVE!
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
This is an unbelievable save from goalkeeper Olivia McDaniel, who has been excellent all match.
Substitute Grace Jale almost finds the corner with a brilliant half-volley but McDaniel stretches and gets fingertips to it. Stunning save!
Post
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
Hannah Wilkinson is such a threat. She gets a touch on the corner but flicks it wide under pressure from the goalkeeper.
Another chance goes begging... Time running out rapidly.
DISALLOWED GOAL
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
Another goal ruled out for offside... And it's the Philippines' Isabella Flanigan who is slipped through but she's gone a yard too early when she slots it past the goalkeeper. New Zealand go up the other end but it's dealt with by the Philippines' plucky defence.
2,500 watch Lionesses train
Sarah Dawkins
BBC Sport in Sydney
England have been preparing for Friday's match against Denmark with a community training session at Central Coast Stadium in New South Wales.
They are in Terrigal, which is by the coast and an hour's drive north of Sydney.
There was an impressive turnout with 2,500 fans coming along to watch the Lionesses train.
Afterwards, the players were officially greeted with a “Welcome to Country” and smoke ceremony by the Darkinjung group. Players then signed autographs and posed for pictures with fans.
SUBSTITUTIONS
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
Goalscorer Sarina Bolden, who has created history here today, is substituted by the Philippines' coach. She gets a high five from all of her team-mates and staff.
Grace Jale replaces captain Ria Percival in a New Zealand change.
Post
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
Good build-up from New Zealand as Rebekah Stott helps switch the play before teeing up Olivia Chance on the edge of the box.
She hits it first time but slices it wide.
'Disaster for New Zealand'
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
Emma Byrne
Former Ireland goalkeeper on ITV1
To lose, to not get anything from this game now, would be a disaster for New Zealand now.
Jitka Klimkova must be thinking about a change, New Zealand are starting to look a bit lethargic.
On the other side, this will be a massive victory for the Philippines.
Post
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
You can see the frustration starting to kick in. Sofia Harrison comes across to track the run of Hannah Wilkinson, who goes down appealling for a free-kick which she is never going to get.
Post
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
The Philippines have not had a shot since the 24th minute - when they scored.
But they are holding on here in Wellington. This would be some result!
DISALLOWED GOAL
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
A huge decision which goes against New Zealand as Jacqui Hand loops a header into the back of the net but it's ruled out for offside by VAR. It was great build-up play from Hannah Wilkinson to chip it back into the middle.
HITS THE WOODWORK
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
Olivia Chance is really making a difference. She curls in a beautiful ball from the left which Jacqui Hand can take in her stride. She just has the keeper to beat but she pokes it onto the left post.
It bounces back out dangerously but goalkeeper Olivia McDaniel reacts to gobble it up.
SUBSTITUTION
New Zealand 0-1 Philippines
Philippines teenager Isabella Flanigan, their number nine, is on up front, replacing Sara Eggesvik.
Eggesvik got the assist in the first half so has more than done her part.
